result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David P Grunwald

defendant.name: Grunwald, David P

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David P Grunwald in court.  Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court for David P Grunwald.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Review hearing held. Defense to file any final agreement documents by 02-13-2023. Court orders case adjourned for final review hearing. Court authorizes Zoom appearance if terms of the agreement are completed. Case adjourned, Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for February 20, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. DPA Progress Report 10.21.22

Defendant David P Grunwald in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  
Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Case in court for Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing. 
Court is in receipt of  the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Elements of the Offense.
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 

The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement. 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and entered a plea of GUILTY
Defendant  examined as to the plea.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  
The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
The Court reviewed the Early Intervention Program Deferred Prosecution Agreement with the defendant.  
The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the proceedings suspended until Review Hearing.  
Parties informed this matter has been reassigned to Judge Stark, Br. 17. Review Hearing scheduled.  Review hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Statements made by DJG.  On motion of the defense, with no objection from the state, Court ordered the no contact be amended to a NO VIOLENT CONTACT ORDER.

Defendant David P Grunwald in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  
Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Status conference held.  Atty. Rosenthal requests a DPA hearing date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant David P Grunwald in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  
Brandon Schwebler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Rosenthal has received discovery and an offer and requests time to review it.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Court ordered no contact with DJG
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

ADDRESS INFO for David P Grunwald
Current: 10752 S Jessica Dr, Oak Creek, WI 53154 United States  (Effective: 05-13-2022)
Prior: 1421 West Edgerton Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53221
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant David P Grunwald in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Defendant David P Grunwald in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  David P Grunwald appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
